title: Authors and Citation
text: Yao-Chung Chen. Maintainer.

title: Authors and Citation
text: Chen Y (2022). twice: collections useful functions analyze transcription factors transposable elements data. R package version 0.1.0, https://ferygood.github.io/twice/.
code: @Manual{,   title = {twice: A collections of useful functions to analyze transcription factors and transposable elements data},   author = {Yao-Chung Chen},   year = {2022},   note = {R package version 0.1.0},   url = {https://ferygood.github.io/twice/}, }

what:
A collections of useful functions to analyze transcription factors and 
    transposable elements data
title:
A collections of useful functions to analyze transcription factors and 
    transposable elements data
text: twice package especially used running repeat analyzing transposable elements transcription factors. Twice manual page

what: convert the ensID in row to gene name for heatmap visualization — ensIDtoName
title: convert the ensID in row to gene name for heatmap visualization — ensIDtoName
text: `ensIDtoName` convert ensembl ID gene name human readibility. takes dataframe matrix ensembl gene ID row names convert common gene name. default species name hsapiens. can also specify name species interested . situation face duplicated row names convert. Therefore, please consider first subset data conversion.

title: convert the ensID in row to gene name for heatmap visualization — ensIDtoName
convert the ensID in row to gene name for heatmap visualization — ensIDtoName
text: df dataframe ensembl ID row names species scientific abbreviation name species, hsapiens homo sapiens (human). default hsapiens.

title: convert the ensID in row to gene name for heatmap visualization — ensIDtoName
text: dataframe(matrix) gene name row names

title: convert the ensID in row to gene name for heatmap visualization — ensIDtoName
code: data(hmchimpGene) data(hmKZNFs337) dfKZNFs <-     hmchimpGene[rownames(hmchimpGene) %in% hmKZNFs337$ensembl_gene_id, ] df <- ensIDtoName(dfKZNFs, "hsapiens")

what: human hg19 repeatmasker annotation file — hg19rmsk_info
title: human hg19 repeatmasker annotation file — hg19rmsk_info
text: repeatmasker annotation file including information transposable elements human (hg19). dataframe object 3 columns. gene_id name transposable element, family_id class name, class_id class name.

title: human hg19 repeatmasker annotation file — hg19rmsk_info
human hg19 repeatmasker annotation file — hg19rmsk_info
text: object class data.frame 992 rows 3 columns.

title: human hg19 repeatmasker annotation file — hg19rmsk_info

title: Human KRAB-Zinc-Finger gene reference data — hmKZNFs337
text: 2 column dataframe including ensembl gene ID common gene name 337 KRAB-Zinc-Finger gene human.

title: Human KRAB-Zinc-Finger gene reference data — hmKZNFs337

title: Gene Expression data of human and chimpanzee — hmchimpGene

title: Transposable elements (TE) data of human and chimpanzee — hmchimpTE
text: TE expression dataframe including 3 replicates human chimpanzee. Row names TE gene ID column names sample ID.

title: Transposable elements (TE) data of human and chimpanzee — hmchimpTE
Transposable elements (TE) data of human and chimpanzee — hmchimpTE
text: object class data.frame 928 rows 6 columns.

title: Transposable elements (TE) data of human and chimpanzee — hmchimpTE

what: Use ComplexHeatmap to visualize KZNFs data from TEKRABber result — kznfsComplexHeatmap
title: Use ComplexHeatmap to visualize KZNFs data from TEKRABber result — kznfsComplexHeatmap
text: function use ComplexHeatmap::Heatmap() visualize KZNFs data generated using TEKRABber. First load built-hmKZNFs337 filter dataframe. dataframe file extension geneDESeq2norm.csv TEKRABber. can specified many KZNFs want visualize. default showing top 40 KZNFs highest row means among samples. face error find function "unit", need load ComplexHeatmap library workspace.

title: Use ComplexHeatmap to visualize KZNFs data from TEKRABber result — kznfsComplexHeatmap
code: kznfsComplexHeatmap(   df,   top = 40,   species = "hsapiens",   fileName = NULL,   orderMean = FALSE,   speciesAnnot = NULL )

title: Use ComplexHeatmap to visualize KZNFs data from TEKRABber result — kznfsComplexHeatmap
text: df TEKRABber geneDESeq2norm table top numeric value show top number genes heatmap species indicate species name convert ID fileName name saving pdf file (specified) orderMean specify want order rows based row means speciesAnnot vector containing species information want add top annotation heatmap

title: Use ComplexHeatmap to visualize KZNFs data from TEKRABber result — kznfsComplexHeatmap
text: ComplexHeatmap heatmap (Formal class Heatmap)

title: Use ComplexHeatmap to visualize KZNFs data from TEKRABber result — kznfsComplexHeatmap
code: data(hmchimpGene) annot <- c("Hs", "Hs", "Hs", "Pt", "Pt", "Pt") kznfsComplexHeatmap(hmchimpGene, top=40, species="hsapiens",                     speciesAnnot=annot) #> Error in kznfsComplexHeatmap(hmchimpGene, top = 40, species = "hsapiens",     speciesAnnot = annot): unused argument (speciesAnnot = annot)

what: Abundance of TEs using pie chart in class levels — pieTE
title: Abundance of TEs using pie chart in class levels — pieTE
text: function takes expression transposable elements table form TEKRABber normalized results. (1) User filter columns related species interested (2) Calculated mean samples combined expression level new dataframe (3) merge based TE class round expression percentages (4) can specify file name path string want save file reference tables

title: Abundance of TEs using pie chart in class levels — pieTE
Abundance of TEs using pie chart in class levels — pieTE
text: teExp filter columns TE expression interested rmsk rmsk reference. can load built-one use fileName name plot want save

title: Abundance of TEs using pie chart in class levels — pieTE
text: ggplot pie chart object

title: Abundance of TEs using pie chart in class levels — pieTE
code: data(hmchimpTE) data(hg19rmsk_info)  df <- hmchimpTE dfSelect <- df[,c(1,2,3)] #only select human columns g <- pieTE(dfSelect, hg19rmsk_info) #> Error in mutate(., csum = rev(cumsum(rev(mean))), pos = mean/2 + lead(csum,     1), pos = if_else(is.na(pos), mean/2, pos)): Problem while computing `pos = mean/2 + lead(csum, 1)`. #> Caused by error in `lead()`: #> ! could not find function "lead"

what:
Filter transposable elements from rmsk reference based on given their gene,
family, and class ID. — rmskFilter
title:
Filter transposable elements from rmsk reference based on given their gene,
family, and class ID. — rmskFilter
text: filtering select transposable elements gene, family, class -stream analysis, provide function help quickly list options . can run function first setting show TRUE see every possibility. provide character vector including name family/class want select. function return subset rmsk dataframe.

title:
Filter transposable elements from rmsk reference based on given their gene,
family, and class ID. — rmskFilter
code: rmskFilter(rmskInfo, gene = NULL, family = NULL, class = NULL, show = FALSE)

title:
Filter transposable elements from rmsk reference based on given their gene,
family, and class ID. — rmskFilter
text: rmskInfo rmsk dataframe, three columns, gene_id, family_id, class_id gene vector including gene names want family vector including family names want class vector including class names want show want first see possible family/class, set TRUE

title:
Filter transposable elements from rmsk reference based on given their gene,
family, and class ID. — rmskFilter
text: subset rmsk dataframe including three columns, gene, family class

title:
Filter transposable elements from rmsk reference based on given their gene,
family, and class ID. — rmskFilter

what: extract the gene/family/class TE information from repeatmasker gtf — saveTErmsk
title: extract the gene/family/class TE information from repeatmasker gtf — saveTErmsk
text: extract TE id/family/class information prepare data visualize abundance TEs using pie chart (refer pieTE())

title: extract the gene/family/class TE information from repeatmasker gtf — saveTErmsk
extract the gene/family/class TE information from repeatmasker gtf — saveTErmsk
text: rmskGTF /path/filename transposable element rmsk gtf fileName provide file name want save result instead just returning .

title: extract the gene/family/class TE information from repeatmasker gtf — saveTErmsk

what: Use ComplexHeatmap to visualize TEs data from TEKRABber result — teComplexHeatmap
title: Use ComplexHeatmap to visualize TEs data from TEKRABber result — teComplexHeatmap
text: function use ComplexHeatmap::Heatmap() visualize TEs data generated using TEKRABber. input dataframe file extension teDESeq2norm.csv TEKRABber. can specified many TEs want visualize. default showing top 40 TEs highest row means among samples. can also specify list filter subset TEs using teFilter parameters. face error find function "unit", need load ComplexHeatmap library workspace.

title: Use ComplexHeatmap to visualize TEs data from TEKRABber result — teComplexHeatmap
code: teComplexHeatmap(   df,   teFilter = NULL,   top = 40,   fileName = NULL,   speciesAnnot = NULL,   teAnnot = NULL )

title: Use ComplexHeatmap to visualize TEs data from TEKRABber result — teComplexHeatmap
text: df TEKRABber teDESeq2norm table teFilter list transposable elements subsets top numeric value show top number genes heatmap fileName name saving pdf file (specified) speciesAnnot vector containing species information top annotation heatmap teAnnot vector containing class family information row annotation heatmap

title: Use ComplexHeatmap to visualize TEs data from TEKRABber result — teComplexHeatmap
text: ComplexHeatmap heatmap (Formal class Heatmap)

title: Use ComplexHeatmap to visualize TEs data from TEKRABber result — teComplexHeatmap
code: data(hmchimpTE) data(hg19rmsk_info)  teComplexHeatmap(hmchimpTE, teFilter=hg19rmsk_info$gene_id[1:10],     speciesAnnot = c("h", "h", "h", "c", "c", "c"),     teAnnot = hg19rmsk_info[c(1:10), ]) #> Error in teComplexHeatmap(hmchimpTE, teFilter = hg19rmsk_info$gene_id[1:10],     speciesAnnot = c("h", "h", "h", "c", "c", "c"), teAnnot = hg19rmsk_info[c(1:10),         ]): unused arguments (speciesAnnot = c("h", "h", "h", "c", "c", "c"), teAnnot = hg19rmsk_info[c(1:10), ])
